intro: Phanera tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phanera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
